title: nf-core/taxtriage pipeline parameters
description: APHL pipeline for triage classification reports

input_output_options.title: Input/output options (Required)
input_output_options.description: Define where the pipeline should find input data samplesheet, database, and save output data.

input.description: Path to comma-separated file containing information about the samples in the experiment.
input.help_text: You will need to create a design file with information about the samples in your experiment before running the pipeline. Use this parameter to specify its location. It has to be a comma-separated file with 6 columns in a header row and at least one row for info. See [usage docs](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jhuapl-bio/taxtriage/main/examples/Samplesheet_git.csv).

db.description: Path to database for Kraken2. If using with --download-db, choose from download options {minikraken2, flukraken2}

outdir.description: Output directory full of files. Report will be generated at <PATH>/multiqc/multiqc_report.html

prelim_and_qc.title: Preliminary and QC
prelim_and_qc.description: Run general maintenance scripts to prep the data prior to classifications/analysis, inlcuding some plotting

remove_taxids.description: Taxid numbers in double quotes ( e.g. "9606" for human). For multiple, example: "9606 2" removes human AND all Bacteria

demux.description: Run Demux on a folder of fastq files

metagenomics_parameters.title: Metagenomics Parameters
metagenomics_parameters.description: Define where the pipeline should find input data and save output data.

top_per_taxa.description: Custom downselect of taxid:limit:rank. For example, it would be 10239:4:S to at minimum present the top 4 species of viruses. Add more with a space
top_per_taxa.help_text: Example: 10239:4:S 2:10:S is the top 10 bacteria species, top 4 viral species at minimum are included

low_memory.description: Dont load db to memory, run from I/O

download_db.description: Download the preset database indicated in --db to --outdir.

taxtab.hint: Options: [default, krona, or a file path to a taxonomy.tab file]
taxtab.description: Taxonomy tab file for krona plots

taxdump.hint: Path to a directory that contains ncbi taxonomy dmp files (names.dmp, nodes.dmp)

save_output_fastqs.description: Save all read classifications as a txt file

top_hits_count.description: Top N organisms to report per sample

k2_confidence.description: Kraken2 confidence, default (empty) is 0.0. Must be between 0 and 1

k2_minimum_hit_groups.description: Kraken2 minimum hit groups for LCA to be called

filter.description: Path to a kraken2 database. Typically, this would be the human reads database for human-derived samples. Deprecated! Choose --remove_taxids insteads

skip_realignment.description: Dont do re-alignment post kraken2 classification

assembly.description: Path to an assembly file. This contains the taxid and relative genome file that can be pulled from Entrez (ncbi). If not called, it auto downloads in the pipeline and requires internet connectivity

get_pathogens.description: Pull remote pathogens reference file from GH

pathogens.description: Path to pathogens txt file. See documentation for format and info.

organisms.hint: Options: Comma-separated taxids or organism names to match to ncbi assembly info. See --assembly for more info. If using organism names, make sure to set it to fuzzy-matching with --fuzzy
organisms.description: Either a string of taxids separated by a space, or organisms names with '' enclosure, separated by space for each enclosed name with ''

organisms_file.hint: Options: [string or single column list of taxids or organism names]. If using organism names, make sure to set it to fuzzy-matching with --fuzzy
organisms_file.description: Either a file or string of taxids separated by a space, or organisms names with '' enclosure

bt2_indices.description: Path to Bowtie2 indices (directory). If not called, it auto creates it from the relevant FASTA file for each sample. Only usable with --reference_fasta

genome.help_text:
If using a reference genome configured in the pipeline using iGenomes, use this parameter to give the ID for the reference. This is then used to build the full paths for all required reference genome files e.g. `--genome GRCh38`. 

See the [nf-core website docs](https://nf-co.re/usage/reference_genomes) for more details.

igenomes_base.description: Directory / URL base for iGenomes references.

igenomes_ignore.description: Do not load the iGenomes reference config.
igenomes_ignore.help_text: Do not load `igenomes.config` when running the pipeline. You may choose this option if you observe clashes between custom parameters and those supplied in `igenomes.config`.

assembly_file_type.description: Assembly text file format. Can be a kraken2 fasta (kraken2) or the one pulled from ncbi (ncbi)

reference_fasta.description: Reference FASTA file to use instead of using ncbi API to pull genomes. Useful for offlined pipelines

distributions.description: List of all metagenome distributions that contain abundances found in public HMP data for each taxa and body site combination

skips.title: Skip Steps
skips.description: Not all steps are required to make a report, choose what to skip upfront. Be aware some analysis plots will be missing depending on what you skip.

skip_plots.description: Skip upfront QC plotting to save time

skip_stats.description: Skip generating stats for each individual taxa per sample

skip_kraken2.description: Skip Kraken2. Will not work with "unknown taxa" mode. You must provide a reference FASTA if this is toggled on.

reference_assembly.description: Perform Reference-Based Assembly. Performs variant analysis by default (mandatory)

get_features.description: Start generating annotations from alignments that take place. Requires LOTS of RAM for large data files/genomes

get_variants.description: Start generating variant call analysis relative to aligned reads to references

skip_multiqc.description: Skip upfront QC plotting to save time

email.help_text: Set this parameter to your e-mail address to get a summary e-mail with details of the run sent to you when the workflow exits. If set in your user config file (`~/.nextflow/config`) then you don't need to specify this on the command line for every run.

multiqc_title.description: MultiQC report title. Printed as page header, used for filename if not otherwise specified.

blastdb.description: Blast Database (local or remote, local must be absolute path)
